ratings.comment: Physics 109 is taught by 2 professors. The first one, Pupa, was amazing, but Susan Coppersmith was just terrible. Coppersmith teaches the sound portion. She often messes up her own examples, and she doesn't know how to convey the material during lecture, which is frustrating. The HW gets more difficult because of this. Read the book.

When I took Physics in the Arts, the first half of the course was taught by the brilliant Pupa Gilbert, and I entered the second half hoping for an equally inspiring professor. Sadly, Professor Coppersmith seemed disorganized and unable to articulate her ideas clearly in lecture. I decided to stop going and read the textbook more. :(

This professor obviously has deep physics knowledge, but can't convey this to her students. She will go on tangents that have nothing to do with what we are learning, and will assume we understand concepts that we never learned. My best advice is to skip lecture and review slides online; it's less confusing than trying to follow her. Read the book.

Her lectures are so frustrating. She is terrible at explaining things and is completely flustered and unorganized. Tests and labs aren't terribly hard, but the homework gets difficult at the end of the semester. I didn't feel that the lectures gave me enough info to do the homework.

Hard to understand- pretty poor at explaining concepts at a high level. She's likely quite brilliant (UW Physics overall has a good academic reputation), but can't get it into words for her students. I stopped going to lecture because it wasn't at all helpful.
She is not a very good professor,but the whole fun for me in going to lecture is that she butchered every demonstration she did.  It was really funny.
one word: boring. Avoid this prof if you can

She's awful. She started teaching halfway through the semester and that's when I stopped going to lecture. She just says exactly what's on her powerpoints, but makes everything confusing, because she seems confused all the time. Labs are so easy, all you have to do is show up, and it really helps your grade. The homework is worthless.

Absolutely useless. She can't keep her own thoughts straight long enough to finish a sentence without interruption. Gets frazzled when trying to operate demos. I quickly stopped attending her lectures. Exams are tough but doable with adequate preparation.

She is useless. I went to the first lecture with her teaching, then stopped.  Homework was easy and not much studying is needed because you get to use a cheat sheet.  I got an AB but I would never take a class with her again EVER.
I think she does blow before lecture. Super hyper and belligerant. Cannot communicate her thoughts whatsoever. Should be banned from teaching
Awful! Homework is impossible. She's crazy, impossible to understand. Should not be allowed to teach

Smells her hair a lot, really weird. She's all over the place, and she does a bad job explaining concepts. She could take a lesson from Albrecht Karle. Tests are mildly difficult, definitely need to come prepared.

She has a good grasp on what she knows, but she has no idea how to communicate it. She gets incredibly nervous and as a result, prone to babbling. A difficult professor to follow, especially with already difficult concepts. I'd avoid her if possible.

Yikes. I could not understand what she was trying to say most of the time.  You could definitely tell she's smart, but she doesn't know how to teach... and if you read the book, her lectures are worthless anyhow. It's straight out of the book.  Luckily, Pupa teaches the 2nd half, which is awesome... so stick it out for that!

I took Physics in the Arts, and the class was pretty easy.  I took it though because I really wanted to learn about music and photography, and I didn't.  She taught the light portion of the class, but knew little about photography.  If you're interested in this class, beware that all TA's and both professors know absolutely nothing about the arts.

Yeah, the hair sniffing thing is weird, and she goes way too fast, kind of like a kitten chasing a ball of yarn - just all over the place, hard to follow.  She's smart, but she assumes the students are as familiar with the material as she is.

Too smart for her own good! She has too much going on in that frazzle-haired head. Her lectures are like sitting down and listening to a crack addict for an hour. The worst is she sniffs her hair, I can't explain this, you'll have to find out. She's helpful, if you can stand to listen to her more.
